intro: Stachycrater zeylanicus, commonly known as the Ceylon stachys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of southern Asia. It is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
